name: Hincmar of Reims
summary: Hincmar was Archbishop of Reims from 845 to 882. He was one of the most important churchmen and theologians of the 9th century. He was a key advisor to several Carolingian kings and was involved in major theological controversies, including the predestination debate with Gottschalk. He wrote extensively on church governance, theology, and canon law. He was a strong defender of episcopal authority and worked to reform the clergy.
